title.native: プリンス・オブ・ストライド オルタナティブ

description:
The series revolves around a closed-down "Stride" club at Hounan Academy. First-year high school students Takeru Fujiwara and Nana Sakurai attempt to restart the club, but they must recruit six members for the team. They ask Riku Yagami to join, but he turns them down by saying that Stride is the one thing he doesn't want to do. However, Takeru and Nana drag Riku into the clubroom to try to convince him.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.native: プリンス・オブ・ストライド GALAXY RUSH

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

At the beginning of the story she's in love with Narumi Kanai, her childhood friend who is now her teacher. She immediately realizes that Narumi is in love with Akane Minagawa and not her. She meets Mugi Awaya, who is in love with Akane, and starts a relationship with him to satisfy each other's loneliness.

She has different attitudes with each character: she's cheerful with Sanae Ebato, her best friend, timid with Narumi Kanai and sincere with Mugi because she trusts him a lot.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

__[Website](http://www.oxt-music.com/)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ Rock (Digital Rock), J-POP, Anison

__Introduction:__
OxT is a Japanese duo consisting of Masayoshi Ooishi and Tomohiro Oshima (better known as Tom-H@ck), who are under record labels Pony Canyon and KADOKAWA, affiliated with FMF Corporation. They originally collaborated under the name Tom-H@ck ft. Masayoshi Ooishi, but was later changed in 2015 to OxT when they went from a collaboration to a unit.

__Biography:__
The duo first came to life when Masayoshi was selected during an audition for the anime "Ace of Diamond", where Tom-H@ck was in-charge of the opening theme song. In a recording session, they eventually landed on a song titled "GO EXCEED!!", which Masayoshi performed and Tomohiro produced.

After this appearance, they would go on for about a year and a half under the name "Tom-H@ck. featuring Masayoshi Ooishi", before Tomohiro fronted to Masayoshi about how the collaboration didn't feel quite right with him only credited as a featuring artist. As a continuation of this, and during their rise of popularity, Tomohiro made a suggestion to Masayoshi asking if they should start a unit, which Masayoshi responded that he always intended to do so. The unit was officially announced under the name OxT on January 18, 2015.

__Members:__
- [Masayoshi Ooishi](https://anilist.co/staff/123728) (大石昌良, オーイシマサヨシ) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [Tomohiro Oshima](https://anilist.co/staff/107596) (大嶋文博, Tom-H@ck) – vocalist, in-charge of composition and arrangement

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/OxT), edited)

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).
